def: An order of birds, including the swans, ducks, geese,flamingoes and screamers.
To agree with, or teach, the doctrines of Puritans; to conformto the practice of Puritans. Bp. Montagu.

The character or characteristic of a sycophant. Hence: -(a) False accusation; calumniation; talebearing. [Obs.] Bp. Hall.(b) Obsequious flattery; servility.The sycophancy of A.Philips had prejudiced Mr. Addison against Pope.Bp. Warburton.
A chloride having a higher proportion of chlorine than anyother chloride of the same substance or series.
Drying; tending to dry. Ferrand.-- n. (Med.)
Formed of wood pulp by molds; relating to casts made of woodpulp in molds.
A term supposed to mean, perforated wind instruments of music,as pipes or flutes. Ps. v. (heading).
Inclined to rut; lustful; libidinous; salacious. Shak.-- Rut"tish*ness, n.
To make irreligious; to turn from religion. [R.]He would dereligionize men beyond all others. De Quincey.
A piece of stiffened lining pasted on the inside of a hatcrown.
